alert.note: Alert for Davis Mountains; Davis Mountains Foothills (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 4:47PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Reeves and east central Jeff Davis Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 447 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles south of Balmorhea State Park, or 13 miles north of Fort Davis, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Star Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
